intro: Tristellateia richardii, commonly known as the richardii starfish flower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers with five petals. The plant has a short, woody stem and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Tristellateia richardii is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
